Women in older parts of Asia are less in favour of divorce compared to younger women

Women with close family ties also have more favourable view on divorce and remarriage

Men, who are likely to be divorced for years, find it really hard to get another wife as some men simply choose to remain single for the rest of their lives. Thus, this is an issue of some significance as it shows how age, status and legal system affects marriage practices in the societies. Through this article let us have some glimpse on all aspects of divorced women’s life in Nepal.

The legal status of divorce

Contrary to the idea of moving on happily after divorce in the west, in Nepal it is not as easy. A lot has been done to reduce and abolish polygamy and some of the legislative changes has allowed women to pursue divorce. Even it has been getting popular for men to seek divorce. However, someone as young as 16 can marry in Nepal and the law also requires the minimum age at 18 to get a divorce. For married couple below to age of 18 have to wait until they attain 18 to apply for divorce and they must provide themselves that they have been living separately for at least 5 years or if a certain petition is granted by the court citing due to mental illness or danger to mental and physical growth of the child. Ceasing to live under one roof, power of attorney, habitual cruelty, incompatibility also means that couples can seek divorce. A same
